entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF FOR THE KUSKOKWIM BAY COAST SUNDAY... An upper level disturbance will promote enhanced west to southwesterly winds early Sunday into Sunday afternoon. Sustained winds of 30 to 40 mph are forecast to overspread the Kuskokwim Bay and coast beginning Sunday morning. This is coincident with high tide and as a result high surf of 1 to 2 feet above highest

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool And Wet Into Next Week... Northern Alaska is now in a cool and wet pattern that will last through next week. This will bring periods of snow to areas of the Interior above 3000 ft this weekend.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph will continue into Saturday causing waves to wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along The Eastern Norton Sound Sunday Through Monday... Strong west winds Sunday into Monday are expected to cause elevated surf along the Norton Sounds Coast Sunday into Monday. Waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along the Yukon Delta Coast Tonight And Again Saturday Night Through Monday... Strong Northwest winds tonight are expected to cause elevated surf tonight along the Yukon Delta. The winds and surf will diminish on Saturday, and then increase again Saturday night into Sunday and continue into Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ....Elevated Surf Through Tonight... Elevated surf will continue through tonight. North winds of 20 to 25 mph will diminish tonight. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. This system will produce heavy rain along with gusty winds, particularly Friday night through Saturday afternoon. 48 hours storm total rainfall is expected to be 1 to 3 inches, and up to 4 inches near Pelican.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 05 at 11:05AM EDT until August 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Deep moist southwest flow will bring tropical moisture into the forecast area this afternoon and through this evening. Expect development of showers and thunderstorms with the potential to produce heavy rainfall in addition to the potential of training storms leading to flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 05 at 3:01PM MDT until August 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot afternoon temperatures between 100 and 105 degrees. * WHERE...Much of east central Wyoming and western Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening.
